newsitem.title: ITALY: Top Italy theatre names France's Lang as director.
newsitem.headline: Top Italy theatre names France's Lang as director.

text.p: Italy's most prestigious theatre on Thursday named former French culture minister Jack Lang as its new artistic director despite opposition from the separatist Northern League party.
The board of the Piccolo theatre appointed Lang to replace Giorgio Strehler who resigned from the post last year.
The Northern League, which controls the local council in this northern Italian city, had urged the Piccolo to find another candidate, saying Lang did not have the experience to run the theatre.
However Lang, who served under former French president Francois Mitterrand, won support from high up in the Italian government.
"This is an excellent choice which I most firmly believe in," Deputy Prime Minister Walter Veltroni said on Thursday.
